tool.name: LAMP
tool.command: python -m lamp cli --input-data "$input_data" --col-idx "$col_idx" --input-sep "$input_sep" --thres-rt "$thres_rt" --thres-corr "$thres_corr" --thres-pval "$thres_pval" --method "$method" #if $positive == "true" --positive #end if --ppm "$ppm" --ion-mode "$ion_mode" #if $ref_path --ref-path "$ref_path" #end if --ref-sep "$ref_sep" #if $cal_mass == "true" --cal-mass #end if #if $add_path --add-path "$add_path" #end if --add-sep "$add_sep" #if $save_db == "true" --save-db #end if #if $save_mr == "true" --save-mr #end if #if $db_out --db-out "$output_sqlite" #end if --sr-out "$output_summary_single_row" --sr-sep "$sr_sep" #if $save_mr --mr-out "$output_summary_multiple_row" --mr-sep "$mr_sep" #end if

param.name: col_idx
param.label: Column Index (name, mz, rt, intensity start)

data.name: output_summary_single_row
data.label: ${tool.name}: Summary table (Single row and separate columns)

data.name: output_summary_multiple_row
data.label: ${tool.name}: Summary table (multiple rows and separate columns)

tool.help:
Galaxy tool wrapper for LAMP ==============================
This tool annotates compounds in LC-MS data using LAMP.
The Liverpool Annotation of metabolites using Mass sPectrometry (LAMP) is a Python package and an easy-to-use software for feature grouping and metabolite annotation using MS1 data only. LAMP groups features based on chromatographic retention time similarity and positive response-based correlations across multiple biological samples. Genome-scale metabolic models are the source of metabolites applied in the standard reference files though any source of metabolites can be used (e.g. HMDB or LIPIDMAPS). The m/z differences related to in-source fragments, adducts, isotopes, oligomers and charge states can be user-defined in the reference file.
Parameters: - Input data file (peak list) - Correlation analysis options - Reference and adduct libraries - Results output formats
See the LAMP documentation for more details.
